title.narrative: CROSS-SECTORAL

description.narrative: Strategies to address cross-cutting issues related to child rights are developed and applied., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid), Evaluation, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Operations Support To Programme Delivery (Covid), Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The Country Programme is designed, implemented, coordinated, monitored and evaluated effectively, efficiently and based on evidence, to deliver quality, inclusive and gender-responsive results for children, adolescents and women, especially the most vulnerable

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strategies to address cross-cutting issues related to child rights are developed and applied.

description.narrative: UNICEF’s sustained Social Behaviour Change Communication (SBCC) through inter-sectoral collaboration led to critical results for the national COVID-19 response and recovery efforts while also improving understanding among decision-makers to strengthen systems for effective community engagement, including expanding partnerships. The support provided to the MoH, MoE and other stakeholders as part of the national COVID-19 RCCE plan helped reinforce messages on COVID-appropriate behaviours and uptake of the vaccine. The SBCC efforts also improved discourse and collaboration among stakeholders through implementation of joint activities by using traditional and new media to engage communities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:04/01/2022
